task.title: Configuring a regular group as the administrative group

taskbody.context:
Use this procedure to change the default administrative group of from wheel to a non-system group.
The following variables are used in this procedure:
Perform this procedure or the previous procedure, but not both.

step.cmd: Create a variable for the group to designate as the administrative group.
step.info: In this example, the name of group to create is serviced. You may choose any name or use an existing group.

step.cmd: Create a new group, if necessary.
Add one or more existing users to the new administrative group.

stepxmp.p: Replace User with the name of a login account on the host:

step.info: Repeat the preceding command for each user to add.

step.cmd: Specify the new administrative group in the serviced configuration file.

substep.cmd: Locate the line for the SERVICED_ADMIN_GROUP variable, and then make a copy of the line, immediately below the original.
Change the value from wheel to the name of the group you chose earlier.

step.cmd: Prevent the root user from gaining access to the browser interface, if desired.

substep.cmd: Locate the line for the SERVICED_ALLOW_ROOT_LOGIN variable, and then make a copy of the line, immediately below the original.
